title: 2025-26 men’s college basketball rankings: Way-too-early top 25
content: Florida captured the national title on Monday night, but Houston is already the favorite at the top for next season.

title: 'Winning time': Florida rallies once again for title
content: Florida rallied from a 12-point deficit to survive a defensive slugfest vs. Houston and earn the program its third national championship since 2006.

title: Houston stunned: 'That broke everybody's heart'
content: Houston squandered a 12-point lead in the second half and finished the national title game with four consecutive turnovers in losing to Florida on Monday night.

title: House settlement inches closer to final approval
content: A judge directed lawyers to address a short list of her remaining concerns about a multibillion-dollar settlement that could reshape college sports.

title: Source: BYU freshman Demin to enter NBA draft
content: BYU freshman guard Egor Demin, a projected lottery pick, will enter the 2025 NBA draft, a source told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Jenkins sues NCAA for limiting pay while at Nova
content: Through a lawsuit filed last week in New York, former NCAA tournament hero Kris Jenkins is suing the NCAA and six conferences for limiting athlete pay and restricting his ability to capitalize off his name, image and likeness while he was at Villanova.

title: Sources: Miami has discovery rights for De Bruyne
content: Inter Miami hold the discovery rights for Manchester City player Kevin De Bruyne, sources have told ESPN, meaning he could play alongside Lionel Messi.

title: Man admits to selling $250K in fake memorabilia
content: A former California resident pleaded guilty to selling hundreds of thousands of dollars in fake memorabilia.

title: 'A big swing-and-miss': Has Deshaun Watson played his last down in the NFL?
content: Browns owner Jimmy Haslam admitted for the first time last week that the 2022 trade for Watson was a failure. What's next for Cleveland and its QB?

title: 'I just have a good feel about the place': A decade later, can Jordan Spieth do it again?
content: Ten years ago, Jordan Spieth rushed through his lone coronation at the Masters. He still believes he can get another shot.

title: Inside the process of making an MLB star's torpedo bat
content: The torpedo bat's rise has changed the industry for the companies that make them. Here is one bat-maker's story.

title: Why Phillies decided to run it back instead of going big in offseason
content: The Dodgers, Mets won the winter, but one of their closest competitors looks a lot like it did a season ago.

title: LeBron James, Luka Doncic and the one player who could swing the playoffs for the Lakers
content: Luka Doncic and LeBron James are constants. But in a loaded West, Austin Reaves might be the difference between a deep playoff run for the Lakers and an early exit.

title: What's at stake on 10-game Tuesday?
content: With playoff seeding up for grabs, here are the key matchups. Plus, updated projections, enhanced standings.

title: How Zach Werenski has leveled up during an emotional season for the Blue Jackets
content: As the team continues to honor the memory of Johnny Gaudreau, the veteran blueliner has been at the forefront.

title: Police charge man over alleged Grealish assault
content: A man has been charged after an alleged assault of Manchester City midfielder Jack Grealish at Old Trafford on Sunday.

title: Ref Cam to be used at Club World Cup in U.S.
content: Supporters will get a new live experience at the Club World Cup with footage from the referee's body camera available to broadcasters during matches.

title: Man Utd to play in Asia three days after PL ends
content: Manchester United's post-season tour of Asia is needed to "drive revenue", according to chief executive Omar Berrada, after the club announced two extra fixtures at the end of the 2024-25 season.

title: Betis 'cautiously optimistic' of signing Utd's Antony
content: Real Betis chief executive Ramon Alarcon has said he is "cautiously optimistic" that Antony will continue at the club beyond this summer.

title: Sources: Man United to rival Chelsea for Delap
content: Manchester United have identifed Ipswich Town's Liam Delap ahead of Viktor Gyökeres, Benjamin Sesko and Victor Osimhen, sources have told ESPN.

title: Leicester teen becomes 2nd youngest PL player
content: Leicester City's Jeremy Monga became the second-youngest Premier League player when he made his senior debut in Monday's 3-0 loss to Newcastle United,

title: Courtois: Madrid wary of Arsenal set-piece threat
content: Thibaut Courtois admitted on Monday that Real Madrid have been working on coping with Champions League opponents Arsenal's set piece threat, but said it's "a matter of time" before Mikel Arteta's team win a trophy.

title: 2025-26 women's college basketball rankings: Way-Too-Early Top 25
content: As this season's title is won, we take a look at the women's college basketball Way-Too-Early Top 25 for 2025-26.

title: Move over, McGregor: Why Chandler is better off with Pimblett
content: It might seem counterintuitive, but for Michael Chandler, Paddy Pimblett is an upgrade from Conor McGregor.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Lerone Murphy still undefeated
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: R.C. Slocum is the 'last one of those guys'
content: It will be a long time before another figure spends half a century working for a program the way that Slocum did at Texas A&M.

title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
content: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.

title: Latson, Miles open 1-2 in 2025-26 women's college basketball transfer rankings
content: Florida State's Ta'Niya Latson, Notre Dame's Olivia Miles and OSU's Cotie McMahon top our transfer rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United join Arsenal in Cunha chase
content: Manchester United are ready to take on Arsenal in a summer move for Wolves forward Matheus Cunha. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi's Miami stay No. 1, Columbus hold on to No. 2 spot
content: A big weekend in Major League Soccer ends with the top three holding steady in our Power Rankings, as Messi and Miami stay top closely pursued by the always tough Columbus Crew and upstarts Vancouver.

title: Can USA Hockey get more elite players to go to the IIHF World Championship?
content: For years, the tournament has been an afterthought for many NHL players. Here's how that could change.

title: Tariff war: Trump escalates, Xi digs in — who will blink first?
content: As trade tensions escalate, President Xi Jinping adopts a confrontational stance against US tariffs, signaling readiness for a prolonged trade war. Beijing retaliates with duties and prepares for economic resilience, while Trump aims to address the trade deficit and appeal to voters. The global markets face turmoil, and analysts warn of potential economic fallout.

title: Kalyan Banerjee, woman MP & Kirti Azad: BJP shares videos, chats of TMC 'spat'
content: For Mamata Banerjee, who is gearing up for the assembly elections next year, public display of infighting within her party Trinamool Congress is the last thing she would want. More so, when the school jobs scam has already given the BJP a strong weapon to nail her and the party.

title: Cong leader P Chidambaram faints due to heat in Ahmedabad, rushed to hospital
content: At the Congress Working Committee meeting in Ahmedabad, P. Chidambaram fainted due to the heat at Sabarmati Ashram and was quickly hospitalized. Congress leaders nationwide convened in Gujarat, a state unconquered for 30 years, to strategize future political moves. The AICC's 84th National Convention, a first for Gujarat in 64 years, addresses key national issues, internal organization, and election preparations.

title: Vaniya Agrawal, who disrupted Microsoft’s event shares resignation email sent
content: Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American software engineer, resigned from Microsoft after protesting the company's alleged role in providing AI technology to Israel's military. She disrupted Microsoft's 50th-anniversary celebration, accusing the company of enabling violence in Gaza. Agrawal cited a $133 million contract with Israel's Ministry of Defense and urged employees to sign the "No Azure for Apartheid" petition before being dismissed.

title: Centre seeks urgent hearing in SC before ruling on pleas against Waqf Act
content: The Centre has filed a caveat in the Supreme Court, seeking a hearing before any ruling on petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025. Several petitions, including those from Asaduddin Owaisi and the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, contest the Act, which aims to improve waqf property management. The petitions are likely to be heard before April 15.

title: IPL 2025: Pooran's milestone mayhem helps LSG sink KKR
content: Nicholas Pooran's explosive, unbeaten 87 off 36 balls propelled Lucknow Super Giants to a thrilling four-run victory over Kolkata Knight Riders in IPL 2025. Pooran's milestone innings, reaching 2,000 IPL runs in record time, helped LSG post a formidable 238/3. Despite valiant efforts from Rahane and Rinku Singh, KKR fell just short of the target.

title: BookMyShow to Kunal Kamra: Not delisted your shows or you as an artist…
content: BookMyShow has responded to allegations of delisting comedian Kunal Kamra's shows, clarifying that it acts as a neutral ticketing platform. The company stated that decisions regarding show listings are made by organizers or venues, not BookMyShow itself. They emphasized their commitment to neutrality and compliance with Indian laws, facilitating ticket sales for diverse events.

title: Draped in sarees, men pose as women to claim MGNREGA benefits in Karnataka
content: A scam in Malhar village, Yadgir, has been exposed where men disguised as women submitted fabricated attendance photos to fraudulently claim Rs 3 lakh in MGNREGA benefits. The deceptive scheme involved uploading images via NMMS, falsely indicating female worker participation in canal dredging work at Pujari's farm.

title: MP 'doctor' who caused death of 7 patients was drawing Rs 8 lakh monthly salary
content: N John Camm, posing as Dr. Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, was arrested for allegedly causing seven patient deaths at Damoh's Mission Hospital. He performed 13 surgeries and examined 70 patients during his two-month tenure, earning a high salary. Investigations revealed his medical registration was invalid, and he lacked proper credentials, raising concerns about hospital hiring practices and oversight.

title: US firm fires 700; 200 linked to Telugu ‘donation scam’, like Apple case
content: Fannie Mae laid off 700 employees, with about 200 terminations, primarily of Telugu origin, due to ethical violations related to the misuse of the 'matching grants program'. Employees allegedly colluded with non-profits like TANA, mirroring a similar scam at Apple where employees were fired for exploiting the company's charitable donation matching program.

title: Zelenskyy claims Ukraine captured two Chinese nationals fighting for Russia
content: President Zelenskyy announced the capture of two Chinese nationals fighting for Russia in Ukraine's Donetsk region, possessing identification and bank cards. Ukraine is investigating the presence of more Chinese citizens within Russian units, signaling concerns about China's involvement and Putin's intentions to prolong the war. Kyiv seeks clarification from Beijing and expects a response from allies regarding this development.

title: 'Pakistan earns Rs 3 billion from Champions Trophy, surpasses targets'
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) declared a Rs 3 billion earning from hosting the ICC Champions Trophy, surpassing their Rs 2 billion target. Amid concerns over the national team's performance, the PCB defended its financial decisions, stating the ICC managed the tournament. Stadium upgrades are underway with Rs 18 billion investment, targeting completion by 2026.

title: Shardul bowls 5 consecutive wides, leaves Pant frustrated
content: In a bizarre turn, Shardul Thakur bowled five consecutive wides in a crucial over against Kolkata Knight Riders. Lucknow Super Giants skipper Rishabh Pant was visibly frustrated. Thakur's wayward bowling eased the pressure on KKR during their chase of a massive target. Despite the extras, Thakur eventually dismissed Ajinkya Rahane.

title: South Korea fires warning shots as North Korean soldiers violate border
content: South Korean troops fired warning shots after North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the heavily fortified border. The North Korean troops, some armed and wearing protective gear, were detected within the demilitarized zone. This incident follows increased North Korean military activity near the border, including terrain clearing and barbed wire installation, amid heightened tensions and political changes in South Korea.

title: Watch: Rathi shows off new celebration after hero Narine's wicket
content: Lucknow Super Giants' spinner Digvesh Rathi grabbed attention by dismissing his idol, Sunil Narine, in a recent match against Kolkata Knight Riders. Rathi celebrated the crucial wicket with a unique gesture, signing the grass, a departure from his controversial 'notebook' celebration. This respectful act followed previous fines for excessive exuberance.

title: 'Physically checked by male, denied restroom': Indian's 8-hour US airport ordeal
content: Indian entrepreneur Shruti Chaturvedi alleges she and a companion were detained for eight hours at Anchorage Airport, Alaska, over a 'suspicious' power bank. Chaturvedi claims extensive interrogation, a physical search, and denial of basic rights occurred. She states the FBI and local police questioned them before releasing them without charges, confiscating her luggage.

title: Feud within TMC? Kalyan Banerjee blames Kirti Azad for leaking 'infighting' WhatsApp chats
content: TMC MP Kalyan Banerjee accused Kirti Azad of leaking internal party conversations regarding a public spat at the Election Commission. Banerjee admitted to the altercation but blamed Azad for provoking him and sharing WhatsApp chats.

title: 'Should not act as per political expediency': SC slams TN guv for 'sitting over' bills
content: The Supreme Court has strongly criticized Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi for withholding assent to Bills passed by the state assembly. The court declared that the governor's actions, including reserving 10 Bills for the President after they were already reconsidered, were illegal and unconstitutional. The court declared these Bills as passed.

title: Why do many people still believe in witches?
content: Belief in witchcraft persists globally, with a significant portion of the population convinced of its existence. While historical witch hunts targeted vulnerable individuals, modern witches embrace nature-based religions and seek personal empowerment. However, experts caution against romanticizing the past and highlight the dangers of unchecked belief in the supernatural, drawing parallels to contemporary conspiracy theories.

title: Watch: Rohit hilariously mimics umpire with 'X' signal
content: Despite Mumbai Indians' loss to Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Rohit Sharma's playful mimicry of the 'X' substitution gesture brought smiles to fans. While his batting performance remained underwhelming, with an early dismissal for 17, his light-hearted moment went viral. The match saw RCB clinch a 12-run victory, fueled by Kohli and Patidar's half-centuries, despite valiant efforts from Varma and Pandya.

title: International students in US file lawsuits over visa termination status
content: The ACLU-NH has filed a lawsuit against the US Department of Homeland Security on behalf of a Chinese doctoral student at Dartmouth College whose F-1 student status was abruptly terminated without explanation. The lawsuit alleges violation of due process rights, as the student met all requirements for maintaining his status.

title: CEO of world's largest asset manager warns of another 20% markets crash
content: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink cautions against optimism regarding the stock market recovery rally, suggesting a potential 20% decline due to substantial US tariffs and concerns about a contracting US economy. He notes that most CEOs believe the US is currently in a recession, with tariffs likely to fuel inflation.

title: UK court rejects India's appeal on Sanjay Bhandari's extradition discharge
content: The Indian government's attempt to appeal Sanjay Bhandari's discharge in the UK Supreme Court has been rejected, raising concerns about potential risks to Bhandari in Tihar jail, including extortion and violence. The court cited human rights grounds, highlighting potential breaches of the European Convention on Human Rights due to Tihar Jail conditions and fairness concerns in Indian criminal trials.

title: Why Netflix’s Adolescence has left Bollywood celebs like divided: Explained
content: Netflix's 'Adolescence' has sparked debate in the Indian film industry, praised for its innovative storytelling and exploration of complex themes. Indian filmmakers appreciate its narrative structure and character depth, while some criticize Netflix India's reluctance to produce similar content. The series' reception highlights the need for greater creative freedom and experimentation within the Indian film landscape.

title: Former India cricketer Kedar Jadhav launches his political career with BJP
content: Former Indian cricketer Kedar Jadhav is set to begin his political career by joining the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) at a ceremony in Mumbai. The 40-year-old, known for his contributions to Indian cricket, including a memorable century against England, will be welcomed by key BJP figures, marking a new chapter after retiring from all formats of cricket earlier this year.

title: Over 200 fall ill in Greater Noida society, water contamination suspected
content: Ajnara Homes Society in Greater Noida is grappling with a health crisis as over 200 residents have fallen ill with symptoms like stomach pain and diarrhoea, raising concerns about contaminated drinking water. Residents suspect negligence from local authorities and society maintenance led to the contamination of the groundwater supply.

title: 'Very strange': BJP slams Rahul over 'Constitution 1000 yrs old' remarks
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders have strongly criticized Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's recent statement that the Indian Constitution is "thousands of years old." The BJP leaders highlighted that the Constitution was drafted in 1949 and implemented in 1950, accusing Gandhi of ignorance and disrespect towards Babasaheb Ambedkar. They further stated that Congress party is confused and speechless after hearing him.

title: How a rumour on Trump’s tariff policy sparked a 7-minute $2.5 trillion stock rally
content: US stock markets briefly surged, adding $2.5 trillion, on a rumor of a potential tariff delay by Trump, highlighting market sensitivity to trade policy. The rally quickly faded as the report proved false, leaving investors uncertain.

title: Farmer leader Pappu Singh, his son and brother shot dead in Uttar Pradesh
content: In Fatehpur's Akhri village, a violent altercation over a tractor blocking a road led to the fatal shooting of Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Pappu Singh, his son Abhay, and brother Pinku. The dispute began when former village head Suresh Kumar requested the tractor's removal, escalating into gunfire involving Suresh's sons and associates.

title: Husband's family offers to adopt and raise child after Muskan found pregnant in jail
content: Muskan Rastogi, accused of murdering her husband Saurabh Rajput, is found pregnant in jail. Preliminary tests confirm the pregnancy. Saurabh's family states they will raise the child if it is biologically related to Saurabh. Muskan and her lover Sahil are in judicial custody for the murder. An ultrasound will determine the pregnancy's duration.

title: Man bobbitises sister-in-law’s rapist, breaks aide’s leg in Bihar
content: In Aurangabad, a 35-year-old man was arrested for allegedly mutilating one man and injuring another, both accused of sexually assaulting his sister-in-law ten days prior. The brother-in-law lured the two men, Nitish Ravidas and Jeevit Ravidas, to his home under false pretenses before the violent confrontation.

title: Lured, drugged and assaulted: 19-year-old claims ‘rape’ by 23 in 7 days in Varanasi
content: In Varanasi, a 19-year-old woman has accused 23 men of gang rape over a week after leaving home on March 29. Her mother's complaint named 12 individuals, with six already arrested. The survivor, after initial reluctance, underwent a medical examination. She alleges drugging and sexual assault at various locations.

title: 2 held for Jalandhar grenade attack; cops find Lawrence Bishnoi, Babbar Khalsa link
content: Punjab Police have apprehended two individuals linked to the grenade attack on BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's Jalandhar residence. The suspects allegedly used an e-rickshaw, which has been recovered, and are connected to a plot involving Zeeshan Akhtar, Pakistan-based Shehzad Bhatti, the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, and Babbar Khalsa International.

title: Hi-tech identity fraud: How UP-based gang tampered Aadhaar biometrics in 12 states
content: A hi-tech identity fraud racket, operating from Uttar Pradesh, has been busted for allegedly tampering with biometric data of over 1,500 Aadhaar cardholders across 12 states. Police arrested four individuals who exploited loopholes in the UIDAI system, running a network of agents who collected documents for illegal updates.

title: 'Modi will be PM again': Maha CM Fadnavis puts an end to successor reports
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis asserted that Narendra Modi will remain Prime Minister in 2029, dismissing succession speculations fueled by Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut's comments. Raut suggested RSS might choose Modi's successor after his meeting with Mohan Bhagwat, hinting at a potential retirement due to age. Fadnavis countered, emphasizing it's inappropriate to discuss succession while Modi is still serving.

title: Shreyas Iyer nominated for ICC Men’s Player of the Month
content: Shreyas Iyer is the sole Indian nominee for the ICC Men’s Player of the Month award for March 2025, recognized for his pivotal role in India's Champions Trophy victory. He amassed 172 runs at an average of 57.33, demonstrating composure under pressure. His crucial innings against New Zealand and Australia solidified his nomination.

title: Jaipur bomb blast case: All four accused sentenced to life imprisonment
content: A Jaipur court sentenced four individuals to life imprisonment on Tuesday for their involvement in the live bomb detection case linked to the devastating 2008 serial blasts. The convicted include Shahbaz Hussain, Sarwar Azmi, Mohammad Saif, and Saif-ur-Rehman.

title: Viral video of Travis Head refusing fan selfie sparks debate on privacy
content: A video shows Australian cricketer Travis Head declining a selfie request. The incident happened in Hyderabad during the IPL season. Fans followed Head in a supermarket. They expressed frustration at his refusal. The video went viral on social media. It ignited discussions about respecting athletes' personal space. Reactions are mixed, with some criticising fan behaviour.

title: Smith, Carroll have 'unfinished business' in Vegas
content: Geno Smith spoke to reporters for the first time since being traded from the Seattle Seahawks to the Las Vegas Raiders . "when people think about my story, coach Carroll was a big part of that," he said . he played in 37 games under Carroll and threw for 8,641 passing yards, 55 touchdowns and 21 interceptions .

title: 'We've got Walt': How Clayton Jr. willed Florida to a title
content: seth greenberg and Jay Williams are the 2025 national champions . he posted a simple message on twitter : "1 more" in 2023-24, his first season with the Florida Gators finished 24-12 . his biggest change was not visible that day .

title: Waqf Act Comes Into Force, Top Court To Hear Pleas Challenging It Next Week
content: A clutch of petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment bill -- passed by the parliament last week -- will be heard by the Supreme Court on April 16.

title: "Congress Going To Have Massive Organisational Reshuffle": Senior Leader
content: The Congress is going to have a "massive organisational reshuffle", AICC general secretary KC Venugopal said on Tuesday as the party's top leaders met here and vowed to embark on the "path of social justice" espoused by Sardar Patel.

title: "Won't Tolerate That Rude MP": Kalyan Banerjee Slams Party MP Amid Chat Leak Row
content: Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee has accused a female party colleague of demanding his arrest, as rifts within Bengal's ruling Trinamool - something Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee before next year's high-stakes Assembly election - became public.

title: "Non-Aligned Nations Like India...": JPMorgan CEO's Advice To Donald Trump
content: Jamie Dimon, chief executive officer at JPMorgan Chase & Co, has warned that the recent tariff measures announced by US President Donald Trump may spark inflation and lead to recession in the world's biggest economy.

title: "Shame... Embarrassment": Trinamool MP After BJP Leaks "Versatile Lady" Chats
content: The BJP has posted private WhatsApp chats between two Trinamool MPs - Kalyan Banerjee and Kirti Azad - that seem to show them squabbling over internal rows and referring to the "beautiful activities of (a) versatile international lady".

title: US Is Quietly Revoking Student Visas From Harvard To Stanford
content: US immigration authorities have revoked a spate of student visas for foreign nationals at major colleges including Harvard, Tufts and Stanford.

title: IPL LIVE: PBKS Lose 3 Wickets In Powerplay; CSK Pacer's Celebration Viral
content: Punjab Kings vs Chennai Super Kings LIVE Score, IPL 2025: CSK pacer Khaleel Ahmed took two wickets in the powerplay against PBKS.

title: Couple Flees Sweden Eco-Retreat, Leaves Behind 158 Barrels Of Human Waste
content: A Danish chef couple, known for their environment-friendly retreat Stedsans, has reportedly fled to Guatemala amid a probe by tax authorities.

title: Women Say "Excuse Me", Beaten Up For Not Speaking In Marathi In Maharashtra
content: Two women, one of them carrying a baby in her arms, were on Tuesday beaten up in Dombivli in the district for allegedly saying "excuse me" instead of speaking in Marathi.

title: Marsh, Pooran Shine With Bat As LSG Beat KKR By 4 Runs In Last-Over Thriller
content: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Lucknow Super Giants Highlights, IPL 2025: KKR suffered a late batting collapse to lose their high-scoring Indian Premier League contest against LSG by a mere four runs at Eden Gardens.

title: Video: Elon Musk Highlights How Russia And US Are Just Two Miles Apart
content: Elon Musk has posted a video on his X page describing the geographical proximity of Russia and the United States.

title: "Could Happen Tomorrow": WHO Chief Says Next Pandemic Inevitable
content: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus highlighted the certainty of future pandemics, urging global preparedness for inevitable health crises.

title: Nathan MacKinnon leads EA Sports NHL 25 Team of the Season
content: EA Sports is honoring the best players of the 2024-25 NHL season . the program looks at players' performances throughout an entire calendar year . Connor Hellebuyck stands tall among goaltenders, leading in wins, save percentage and save percentage .

title: More than a shooter: How Azzi Fudd lifted UConn to title
content: a year ago during the tournament, azzi Fudd woke up so she could rehab her right knee . she had torn her ACL during a practice two games into the 2023-24 season . in high school, when she tore her aCL the first time, gyms were closed because of the COVID-19 pandemic .

title: Lil Wayne visits Bill Belichick in Chapel Hill, receives UNC football jersey
content: With spring practices in full swing around the country, the  North Carolina Tar Heels  welcomed a visitor with some serious star power over the weekend -- Lil Wayne. The famed rapper visited the Tar Heels' football facilities Saturday in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, where he met head coach Bill Belichick, among others. Two Legends.  pic.twitter.com/7gWVhunTZN Lil Wayne received a custom North Carolina football jersey, with his nickname "Tunechi" and the No. 17, a nod to his roots in New Orleans' 17th Ward. Shhh...The Fireman Coming. 🔥  pic.twitter.com/Q4DLrYlMM1 Lil Wayne is a known  Green Bay Packers   superfan , but he has also expressed support for Belichick in his new position. When the longtime  New England Patriots  coach was  officially hired by  the Tar Heels in December, the artist congratulated Belichick  on social media  -- writing "Man much respect 2da GOAT coach." "Tha Carter VI," Lil Wayne's latest studio album, is slated for release in June.

title: Scottie Scheffler's success on the course starts with his work off it
content: Defending champion swung and made contact, replicating his sliding swing . he made his left foot slip and fall into the bunker while his right leg folded awkwardly beneath him . the 2024 masters will be held on saturday .

content: 10 most impressive mountain ranges in the world Pygmy Hippo Day 2025: 10 facts about these adorably trendy animals Meet Rajesh Khanna's beautiful granddaughter Naomika Saran Shruti Haasan’s Timeless Obsession with Red and Black Ensembles ​Allu Arjun's birthday moments over the years Shweta Tiwari inspired festive looks for a perfect Baisakhi celebration Top 9 most remarkable UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the US Signs of the Zodiac That Will See Financial Success in 2025 How to make Instant Sooji Appe for breakfast

title: No Longer Extinct: Dire Wolves Howl Again After 12,000 Years
content: Billionaire Elon Musk reacted to the news, posting his own Wishlist. "Please make a miniature pet wooly mammoth," Musk posted on X, while resharing his own post.

title: Video: Dog Fights Off Leopard, Returns To Feed Puppies Despite Injuries
content: A female dog exhibited incredible bravery by warding off a leopard attack before returning to feed her puppies, despite suffering multiple wounds, in Mumbai's Goregaon.

title: Will Trump’s tariffs trigger a recession in US? Signs economists are watching closely
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents to unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Fantasy baseball waiver wire: Get these players on your roster immediately
content: we tend to lean heavily on batters who call more hitter-friendly environments their homes . Oracle Park, T-Mobile Park and Petco Park are three notables on that side of the coin . this week's most-recommended pickups for standard ESPN leagues .

title: New index to assess performance of gram panchayats
content: Based on the rating system, the highest number of D-category panchayats are in Chhattisgarh, closely followed by Uttar Pradesh

title: Negative policies driving State; major conspiracy behind Kancha Gachibowli land sale: KTR
content: BRS working president says he’ll reveal the details of conspiracy hatched by Congress and BJP in 2-3 days

title: Lorry driver’s daughter tops Arts stream, while farm worker’s daughter gets the second place
content: Poverty did not deter these two girls from overcoming all odds and putting up an impressive show in the II PU exam

title: Andhra Pradesh Tourism Minister Kandula Durgesh to visit Mumbai to attract investments in hospitality sector
content: He will participate in the 20th South Asia Hotel Investment Conference and Workshop, scheduled to take place at the Powai Lake in Mumbai, say officials

title: NHRC notice to States on difficulties faced by prisoners
content: Human Rights Commission took suo motu cognisance of the poor conditions in jails, especially for women inmates and their children

title: Excise leading State’s united fight against drug menace: Minister M.B. Rajesh
content: Minister praises Excise department for leadership in combating drug abuse, highlighting ‘Operation Clean Slate’ success and high conviction rates.

title: Idukki declared green district under Malinya Muktham Navakeralam
content: Minister says joint effort by local bodies, business establishments, schools, colleges and various offices helped achieve the goal of garbage-free green district tag. Erattayar wins best green grama panchayat award

title: Hubballi girl secures fourth rank in Arts stream
content: Ineshka Nadugaddi is a student of Shri Kadasiddeshwar Arts College and H.S. Kotambri Science Institute

title: Two-thirds of bottled water samples unsafe for drinking, finds Health Department
content: Contaminants found in the samples include pesticide residues, fluoride and total dissolved solids such as calcium and magnesium, says Minister

title: Karnataka High Court directs KPSC to set up exam centre for pregnant woman at Kalaburagi
content: ‘Authorities can’t contended that it is waste of money to conduct exam for one candidate when crores of rupees are wasted due to lack of planning’

title: Kalaburagi performs poorly in II PU exam
content: Despite the several steps aimed at improving the performance, the district slips to the 31st place in the State

title: Kollam forges ahead with comprehensive development: Balagopal
content: Minister says steps have been taken to develop tourism and commercial potential of the Kollam port in a way that will benefit the district’s future development plans

title: TDP leader completes 50 days of ‘Gadapa Gadapa Ki Vastunna’ programme
content: Kotamreddy Giridhar Reddy personally listens to the problems of people in 18 village panchayats and four divisions in the city limits of Nellore Rural constituency

title: Kozhikode Corporation passes annual project plan of ₹246.60 crore
content: The highest allocation of ₹47.22 crore is for sanitation, hygiene, and water conservation, while the housing sector gets ₹25.92 crore

title: Campaign to be launched to popularise WhatsApp-based governance service ‘Mana Mitra’ in Andhra Pradesh from April 15
content: Village and Ward Secretariat staff will visit all houses across districts, assisting residents in saving the Mana Mitra number and demonstrating how to use the platform effectively, say officials

title: CM announces campaign to ensure school enrolment of migrant children
content: The campaign, scheduled for May, will focus on securing school admission for all children residing in migrant labourers’ camps and addressing the educational challenges faced by the vulnerable group.

title: Will make Kurnool GGH on par with corporate hospital by 2029, says Minister Bharath
content: Industries and Commerce Minister, in the presence of District Collector and other hospital authorities, inaugurates new 2D Echo Colour Doppler machine in the cardiology department of the GGH

title: Justice took too long: Dilsukhnagar remembers twin blasts horror
content: The culprits shouldn’t have been fed and taken care of all these years, they should have been hanged right after they were convicted, says one of the survivors

title: Construction worker’s daughter from a govt. college secures fifth rank in Arts
content: Nagaveni Raichur, a student of Gopanakoppa college in Hubballi, even worked part-time during vacation to support her parents

title: U.S. tariff effect: aqua farmers threaten to observe crop holiday
content: Traders are deceiving farmers on the pretext of crisis and procuring stocks at lesser prices, they allege

title: Telangana screens 17.96 lakh govt school children, over 87,000 identified with vision problem
content: Of the 18.16 lakh students registered in the government school database, 17.96 lakh were screened of which 87,244 students were diagnosed with refractive errors; spectacles have been distributed to 68,951 of them as of April 4

title: Jagan asks police not to play mute spectator to deteriorating law and order in State
content: YSRCP chief consoles the bereaved family members of Kuruba Lingamaiah, who was allegedly murdered by TDP activists in Ramagiri mandal in Sri Sathya Sai district

title: Special Cells to be formed in all districts in Andhra Pradesh to deal with cases related to Non-Resident Telugus
content: They will operate within the District Collectorate premises for easy accessibility and effective coordination with the government departments, say officials

title: Revamped multilingual library opens at Kollam district prison
content: Library houses around 4,000 books in nine different languages and is a joint initiative of the District Subcollector’s Office and the Cuckoo Forest School at Krishnagiri, Tamil Nadu

title: 2025 International Booker Prize shortlist: Banu Mushtaq’s story collection Heart Lamp makes history as first Kannada-language book shortlisted
content: Heart Lamp, translated by Deepa Bhasthi, is a collection of 12 short stories written by Banu Mushtaq between 1990 and 2023

title: First phase of Kottayam Science City will open by mid-May: Jose K. Mani
content: High-level review meeting held at project site on Tuesday. Work on the project, which began in 2014, had hit several delays

title: ED takes Tamil Nandu Minister K.N. Nehru’s brother Ravichandran to office for questioning
content: The probe pertains to an alleged ₹22 crore worth bank loan fraud linked to a real-estate entity named TVH Group, promoted by Mr. Ravichandran; seraches continue for the second day

title: Pleas against Waqf Act: Centre files caveat in Supreme Court, hearing likely on April 15
content: Caveat is filed by a party in the high courts and the Supreme Court to ensure that no orders are passed without hearing it

title: Plane spotting, a niche hobby with a sizeable social media following catches on in Kerala
content: Anamika, a 17-year-old aviation enthusiast, defies stereotypes as the only female member of Plane Spotters Kerala. Its members regularly post airline trivia on its much-followed social media handles, including jetliners’ tail fin numbers.

title: Cases of home births will be dealt with legally: Kerala Health Minister
content: ‘Provisions under Kerala Public Health Act and Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita will be invoked if people resort to such unconventional and unscientific methods’

title: Property registration in 15 mins | Telangana to introduce online slots at 22 sub-registrar offices from April 10
content: Amendments would be made to existing laws to address the issue of double registration of properties: Revenue Minister

title: Farmers discontent grows in upper, north Kuttanad as disputes hit paddy procurement yet again
content: Unseasonal rain impacts paddy procurement in Kuttanad, leading to delays and disputes with millers, who are now pushing harder for additional concessions in procurement rates.

title: Dubai Crown Prince's India visit paves way for stronger bilateral collaboration: PM Modi
content: Al Maktoum arrived in the national capital on a two-day India visit. He is travelling to Mumbai after concluding his engagements in Delhi

title: D Uddhav Thackeray vows to reclaim Konkan, says his is the ‘only true Shiv Sena’
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) lost key bastions in the Konkan region—including Raigad (to NCP) and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg (to BJP)

title: China’s mega dam will be ‘water bomb’: Arunachal MP
content: Experts expressed deep concern over the proposed Great Bend Dam on Yarlung Tsangpo, the Brahmaputra’s upstream in Tibet

title: 19-year-old allegedly gang-raped by 23 people over six days, six arrested
content: Out of 12 named accused, six were arrested on April 6, 2025, and efforts are on to nab the rest of the accused

title: Supreme Court finds Tamil Nadu Governor’s conduct on 10 re-passed Bills was “unconstitutional”, puts Governors on the clock
content: Court deems 10 Bills to have received assent; fixes time limits of one to three months for Governors to take a call on future Bills, citing sense of expediency in Article 200; says Governors do not have a “pocket veto”

title: GMC announces 5% rebate on property tax paid in full by April 30
content: Commissioner directed revenue officials and administrative staff to create public awareness about this benefit

title: BJP leader, others booked for altering Shobha Yatra route in Aligarh
content: Shakuntala Bharti leads procession through sensitive areas, sparking scuffle; accused booked for violating police guidelines on route change

title: Rupee sinks 50 paise to settle at 86.26 against U.S. dollar
content: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 85.89 and swung between a high of 85.82 and a low of 86.29 against the greenback. The unit ended at 86.26 (provisional), registering a loss of 50 paise from its previous closing level

title: Bengal school appointments row: Rahul Gandhi urges President Murmu to ensure those selected fairly get to keep job
content: ‘Treating teachers selected through fair means on par with tainted teachers is a serious injustice,’ he said and pointed out that most ‘untainted’ teachers have served for nearly a decade

title: Tribal hamlet in Coimbatore to get road connectivity at ₹1.62 crore: Minister
content: The Minister was responding to AIADMK MLA A.K. Selvaraj, who moved a calling attention motion seeking road connectivity to the hamlet, where 24 tribal families reside in the forest area

title: Jammu and Kashmir’s MLAs seek discussion on Waqf Act in Assembly
content: Jammu and Kashmir House adjourned amid uproar over disallowed discussion on Waqf (Amendment) Act, sparking protests from members

title: Uttar Pradesh cabinet approves hike in daily allowance for PRD personnel
content: Finance Minister Suresh Kumar Khanna said that the current daily allowance of ₹395 per personnel would be increased by ₹105, taking it to Rs 500 per day per person

title: II PU results: Indu PU College in Kootur bags first rank in Arts for 10th consecutive year in Karnataka
content: Vagishayya, Principal of Kottur’s Indu College, told The Hindu that nothing but hard work was behind the extraordinary feat

title: Mallikarjun Kharge slams BJP for appropriating Patel’s legacy, recalls he banned RSS
content: There was almost daily correspondence between the two. Nehruji used to take his advice on all matters. Nehruji had immense respect for Patel sahab, says Mallikarjun Kharge

title: NIA searches multiple locations linked to BKI ‘terrorist’ Goldy Brar in Haryana and Uttar Pradesh
content: The case is related to the December 2024 grenade attacks at Warehouse Club and Human Club at Sector-29 in Haryana’s Gurugram

title: Dhinakaran, Panneerselvam demand rollback in price of LPG cylinder, petrol, diesel
content: The AMMK leader said the hike had been made at a time when people were already reeling under the increase in prices of essential commodities

title: Police register FIR on 900 Kia engines ‘missing’ from Penukonda plant
content: According to a preliminary inquiry the theft is suspected to have occurred during the transportation of the engines from Chennai to Penukonda

title: Dharmapuri elephant death: CB-CID will thoroughly probe suspicious death of suspected poacher, says T.N. Forest Minister Ponmudy
content: The Minister was responding to a calling attention motion moved by PMK floor leader G.K. Mani and CPI floor leader T. Ramachandran into the death G. Senthil Kumar, a suspected poacher

title: What are the 10 Bills of Tamil Nadu withheld by Governor R.N. Ravi, now considered assented to after Supreme Court verdict?
content: Originally 12 Bills of Tamil Nadu, mostly dealing with appointments of Vice-Chancellors in state-run universities, were sent by the State Legislature for consent to the Governor between January 2020 and April 2023. The Governor sat on them indefinitely.

title: Palliative care training programme for healthcare professionals in 14 States launched
content: Participants will learn to manage complex symptoms in palliative care and will in turn mentor their peers and medical students; the project is an initiative of Pallium India and the Singapore International Foundation

title: Kerala Ministers, leaders hail Supreme Court verdict against TN Governor
content: Kerala Ministers and LDF leaders say apex court's verdict is a blow in the face of the Centre, which allegedly tries to use Governors as their tools

title: T.N. CM Stalin hails Supreme Court verdict on Governor Ravi’s assent to Bills as victory for all State governments
content: The apex court had come down heavily on Mr. Ravi, stating the reservation of 10 Bills by him for consideration of the President was in contravention of Constitutional provisions

title: Five big controversial actions of Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi
content: On April 8, 2025, the Supreme Court invoked powers to declare as many as 10 Bills on which he had delayed action, effectively approved
